{"step_by_step_thinking": "Juvenile nasopharyngeal angiofibroma is a highly vascular tumor that commonly presents with profuse bleeding. The main vessel involved in bleeding from this tumor is the internal maxillary artery. This artery supplies blood to the nasal cavity and is known to be the primary source of bleeding in cases of Juvenile nasopharyngeal angiofibroma.", "answer_choice": "C. Internal maxillary artery"}
